title: How to Stop an Echo on Discord

steps.title: Open Discord.
steps.content: Open Discord. You'll find this app in your Start menu or Applications folder. Krisp, the noise-filtration software, is not available in the web app.

steps.title: Join a voice chat.
steps.content: Join a voice chat. Double-click the voice channel to begin a voice chat. For more information, read How to Talk in Discord . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click the icon of varied-length vertical lines.
steps.content: Click the icon of varied-length vertical lines. It's next to the "End Call" icon in the bottom left corner of the app window. [2] X Research source When you hover your mouse over the icon, it says Noise Suppression powered by Krisp.

steps.title: Click the switch to turn it on .
steps.content: Click the switch to turn it on . If the switch is greyed out, it is not enabled. [3] X Research source You can also click the gear icon to the right of your username in the bottom left corner of the app window, then click Voice & Video > Noise Suppression under the "Advanced" header.

steps.title: Open Discord.
steps.content: Open Discord. This app looks like a game controller on a blue background. You'll find this on your Home screen, in the app drawer, or by searching.

steps.title: Join a voice chat.
steps.content: Join a voice chat. Tap the voice channel you want to join and tap Join Voice or read How to Talk in Discord .

steps.title: Click the icon of varied-length vertical lines.
steps.content: Click the icon of varied-length vertical lines. It's next to the gear icon in the window that slides up from the bottom of your screen when you join a voice chat. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Enable Noise Suppression.
steps.content: Tap Enable Noise Suppression . This will enable the feature and you can disable it by tapping that icon again and tapping Disable . [5] X Research source You can also go to Settings > Voice > Voice Processing > Noise Suppression .
